page.title: 12Village social life
page.content: The Village Hall in Charney Bassett (which was formerly a Methodist chapel) is used by various organisations. The Youth Club for the 10-20 age group, has approximately 40 members, and meets one evening per week. Activities include billiards, table tennis, darts, draughts and chess. There is an occasional outing or disco. The Women's Institute (about 12 members) meet once a month. There are also Keep Fit classes (6 members) once a week. Other activities which take place at the Public House ("The Chequers") include darts and crib matches and meetings of the Tennis Club and the Amateur Dramatic Society.
